summary: This is an email chain from September 12, 2019, between FBI personnel discussing activities for a weekly report. It mentions a guilty verdict from the previous day and the swearing out of two search warrants related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an initial email asking for significant activities for the weekly report from the FBI New York office's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.

events.title: Guilty verdict in related case
events.description: A guilty verdict was obtained in a case, presumably related to the Epstein investigation, the day before this email.

events.title: Two search warrants sworn out
events.description: Two search warrants were sworn out on the day of this email correspondence.

keyFacts: The email is dated September 12, 2019, and discusses activities for an FBI weekly report.
It references a 'guilty verdict' obtained the previous day (September 11, 2019).
It states that two search warrants were 'sworn out' on September 12, 2019.
The correspondence involves the FBI's New York office, specifically Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking).
The subject line and context indicate the activities are 'Epstein related'.
